Weather: October was abnormally cold
In short, October can be summed up as abnormally cool.
01 Nov 2019, 15:18 by Stavanger Aftenblad
Although the average temperature was only 0.3 degrees lower than normal, the last 20 years have only experienced a colder October month in the years 2016, 2012, 2009, 2003 and 2002, writes Roar Inge Hansen in Storm Geo.


Jer Kjersti Svalland

The rainfall was close to normal with 162 mm in Stavanger during 25 rainy days. Three "penultimate days" are also quite normal. They took place October 5-6 and 29. On the other hand, in the autumn of October, the wind was unusually calm with only three days of snowfall at Sola.
The rest of the country
October was the coldest of many years in Norway. We have to go all the way back to 2009 and 2003 to find the equivalent.
According to the Meteorological Institute, the monthly temperature for the whole country was 1.4 degrees below normal.
- It was relatively coldest in Northern Norway, especially Troms and Finnmark, where several stations had deviations from 2 to almost 4 degrees below normal. A couple of stations in Western Norway had monthly temperatures of 0.1 to 0.5 degrees above normal, meteorologists said.
In terms of monthly temperature, it was lowest on Sjufjellet in Balsfjord with 5.6 minus degrees. Then followed the S√¶tertinden in Tjelsundet and Kistefjell in Lenvik with 5 minus degrees. All these stations are located in Troms.
